document_data.title: Volo's Guide to Baldur's Gate II
document_data.author: [[Ed Greenwood]]
document_data.mainbody:
{{quote|''In this, the sixth indispensable travel guide by [[Volothamp Geddarm]], famed traveler of the Realms, the wonders of the mysterious South are laid bare for all to see. Adventurers seeking their fortunes in the lands made famous by the [[Baldur's Gate II: Shadows of Amn]] computer game will find all the dangers and treasures this rich territory has to offer. And as always, the finest establishments on the gold coasts of [[Amn]] and [[Tethyr]] are rated with the handy coin, pipe, and tankard system.''

''Learn:''

* ''Where in [[Athkatla]] you can speak with a painting.''
* ''Why [[wizard]]s keep turning up dead in [[Hallowturrets House]].''
* ''How one guildmaster can ship goods across the city in total secrecy.''
* ''Whose jeweled bird can deliver secret recorded messages.''
* ''What treasures are guarded by reefs and sahuagin near [[Hook Isle]].''
* ''When to experience the full splendor of the [[Dome of the Rose]].''

''Suitable for all levels of play.''

''Special note: This edition of ''Volo's Guide to Baldur's Gate II: Shadows of Amn'', intended for travelers from beyond the borders of [[Faerûn]], contains notes and commentary by the famous archmage and sage, [[Elminster Aumar|Elminster]].''}}
